content.question: A small sphere is thrown through the air and follows the parabolic path shown in the figure. Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the highest point the sphere reaches. Assuming air resistance is negligible, which of the following claims is true of the sphere while it is in motion?

choices.label: The vertical component of the sphere’s velocity is at a maximum at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The horizontal component of the sphere’s velocity is zero at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The acceleration of the sphere is constant.
The displacement of the sphere is zero at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The acceleration of the sphere is constant.
